commands.--load: Load and import templates (like cursor rules)

examples: cx -h basic            # Show help for basic commands
notes: Use -h followed by a category name for detailed help
Configuration is stored in ~/.aictx/config.json

output.description: Control how the output files are generated

commands.--no-minimize: Override config to generate uncompressed output

notes: Minimized files have .min extension
Compression removes unnecessary whitespace and comments

snapshots.description: Create and manage snapshot versions of your context

commands.-sm \"message\": Create a snapshot with a message
commands.-s -m \"message\": Alternative way to create a snapshot with a message

notes: Snapshots are stored in ./context/snap/
Snapshots include timestamps for versioning
Use messages to make snapshots more identifiable

commands.-tm \"message\": Create a template with a message
commands.-t -m \"message\": Alternative way to create a template with a message

notes: Templates are stored globally in ~/.aictx/templates
Templates can be shared between projects
Use meaningful names for better organization

messages.description: Add descriptive messages to your context files

commands.-m \"message\": Add a message to the context file

examples: cx ./src -m "added login"  # Create context with message
notes: Messages are converted to kebab-case in filenames
Spaces and special characters are replaced with hyphens
Messages help track context purpose

commands.--clear -s -t: Clear all files (code, snapshots, and templates)

notes: Use with caution - cleared files cannot be recovered
Snapshots and templates can be cleared separately
The context directory is removed if empty

ignore.description: Manage file and directory exclusion patterns

commands.-i, --ignore <pattern>: Add a glob pattern to exclude files/directories

examples: cx -i "**/*.min.js"   # Exclude all minified JS files
notes: Exclusion patterns are saved in ~/.aictx/exclude.json
Patterns use glob syntax (like .gitignore)
Binary files are automatically excluded
Patterns are applied in addition to default exclusions
Directories are automatically appended with /** to exclude all contents
